description.narrative: Equity investment to support business expansion plans for a pan-African banking group.

The Project is expected to make a significant contribution to the financial sector and economic development in SSA. The Project''s expected development impact in countries and regions where the Group is present is summarized below: (i) Increase Access to Credit: The proposed investments in the Group are expected to improve access to credit in SSA as they will enable the bank to maintain and/or grow credit provision to the domestic economies where it operates, including to underserved market segments (e.g., agribusiness, climate change, SMEs and microenterprises); (ii) Develop the Financial Sector in IDA and Conflict-Affected Countries: the Group has demonstrated its commitment to IDA and post-conflict countries by strengthening and/or establishing operations in some of the most difficult environments, making it a pillar of financial sector stability in those countries and a link between them and their more stable neighbors; (iii) Create/maintain employment : By helping the Group to better serve its clients in the countries within which it operates, the Project will also help generate job opportunities for the bank''s clients thereby creating or maintaining employment opportunities for more people in the region.
